intro: Tephrosia sara-almeidae, commonly known as Sara-Almeida's tephrosia, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or white in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
